utterance.speaker: JACK SINCLAIR
utterance.content: Living room, 9:03PM. EMF level spiking off the chart.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Hello? Is anyone there?

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Mercy … I can see it. Mercy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, are you using me as a shield against flesh eating zombies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, I just wanted you to have a better view.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa … where’re you going. I really think we’re safe, we’re in pairs.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sorry, Dad. You’re going to have to fend for yourself. I’m Skyping with Ashley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Right in the middle of father daughter zombie time? Can’t you do it later?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He’s not available later. He’s got a dorm meeting, then a seminar after that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know he’s busy. And you are very thoughtful to be so accommodating, sweetheart. But a healthy relationship is based on mutual respect. I mean, think about what kind of signal you’re sending if you’re the one always rearranging your schedule at the other one’s beck and call. I mean, if you just drop everything the very moment that –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. Hang on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m worried about Alexis. I think her not getting into Stanford has upset the balance of power in her relationship with Ashley.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Castle, I wouldn’t worry about that. I mean, Alexis is a girl and Ashley is a teenage boy. I’d say she still holds most of the power.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Ghost Wranglers are here? Okay, that’s why I love these guys. The body’s not even cold, they’re already tracking down the ghost.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why doesn’t it surprise me that you actually watch that ridiculous show?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ridiculously awesome. Jack Sinclair is hands down America’s most accomplished ghost hunter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … Castle… Jack Sinclair is the name of our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the hunter becomes the hunted.

utterance.speaker: STEVE FULLER
utterance.content: He was here doing a special about the house. You know, for his TV show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why this place?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: It has a bit of a history.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean paranormal history?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Detective, I’m not saying I believe in that stuff, okay? But I’ve owned the McClaren house for over twenty years and when the phone rings about this place, odds are it’s not a busted toilet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anybody living there now?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Not for years. It’s hard getting tenants to stick around. So when this Sinclair guy called, I figured what the hell. Maybe he could clear the place up. Make it rentable. But after what just happened…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What exactly did just happen?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: His throat was slit almost from ear to ear. Jugular, superior thyroid, common carotid left and right. You name it, it’s been severed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that explains all the blood.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Here’s what I can’t explain. Depth and nature of the wounds tell me that the killer got up close and personal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then where are the footprints?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not just that. Look at the blood spatter. You cut all those arteries and the spray is going to come fast and it’s gonna come strong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll say. It went everywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But it shouldn’t’ve. Some of it should have landed on the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet every drop of it landed on the floor. The spray is completely unobstructed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Exactly. It doesn’t make sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless … the blood passed right through the killer.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Are you saying a ghost did this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please don’t encourage him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m saying, maybe Mr. Sinclair finally met a wraith he couldn’t wrangle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, who called this in?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: I’m Jack’s producer. I worked with him for the last four years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Lulu, we just need to know everything that happened before you called 911.

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: Okay. Jack went into the house around 7 and then he went on lockdown a few minutes after that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, he locks himself into the house for the night. It’s standard protocol for ghost hunters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh. And was he in there alone?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: Yeah. We always do a clean sweep of the place right before we start. So he – he locked the doors and then I went into the tech van to watch the feed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And were the cameras rolling the whole time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The infrared cameras are to detect unexplained thermal anomalies.

utterance.speaker: JACK SINCLAIR
utterance.content: Living room, 9:03PM. EMF level spiking off the chart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s an electromagnetic field meter. That’s a tool of the ghost busting trade. It’s used to measure spikes in paranormal … energy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s just watch.

utterance.speaker: JACK
utterance.content: Hello? Is anyone there? Mercy. I can see it. Mercy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like he was begging his killer for mercy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: That’s – that’s it. That’s when all the camera signals cut at once.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what could explain the picture suddenly going out like that?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s never happened before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there was that last episode of The Sopranos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. There’s no way. Jack had to have been in there with someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any enemies? Anybody he was having problems with recently?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: No, not that I know of. He… he did show up to lockdown upset.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where he was coming from?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: No. He pulled up in a cab, grabbed his gear, and just went inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anyone else have keys to this place?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: Just Jack and Barry B.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Barry Bavetta. That’s Jack’s cameraman. Where is Barry? Doesn’t he usually do lockdown with Jack?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: He and Jack had an argument this afternoon. Things got pretty heated and then Barry just quit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could he have programmed the cameras to turn off like that?

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: Actually, yeah, he could.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Barry Bavetta checked out of his hotel in a hurry at 7:30.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm. That’s enough time to make it back to the house by 9 when Jack was killed. Barry’s phone is still going straight to voicemail.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the manager gave me his credit card info, so if we’re lucky he’s out there using it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. I’m going to start scrubbing this footage from inside the house. Maybe there’s something in there that can implicate this guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right. Hey, we’re still on for dinner tomorrow night, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Jenny’s totally psyched. She’s never really hung out with Lanie before, so cool.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, just to let you know, Lanie’s going to be getting off a double shift, so she could be a little cranky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Maybe we should reschedule. I mean, isn’t the whole point for Jenny and Lanie to get along?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, she’ll be cool. Just don’t say anything … controversial.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like what? What’s controversial?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bingo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bingo? Don’t talk about bingo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, Barry Bavetta’s been busy and so has his lap. Dude has racked up a hell of a tab at a strip club by the airport. First charge, a hour after the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt your fun, Barry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We heard you were racking up quite a bill. Or is that billing quite a rack?

utterance.speaker: BARRY BAVETTA
utterance.content: So what, getting a lap dance is illegal now? Look, I was just blowing off some steam. Haven’t had the best day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, so we heard. Your producer said that you and Jack Sinclair had a falling out today.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: So this is about Jack? Yeah, we got into it. It wasn’t the first fight we ever had, but I made sure it’ll be the last.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why don’t you tell us what happened, Barry.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Jack screwed me over is what happened. Told me last minute I wasn’t going on lockdown with him tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any reason?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: The only on he gave is, ‘he’s the boss’, but It’s ‘cause he’s jealous. Worried I’m going to walk off with all the credit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Because the episode we’re doing tonight, the McClaren house, was my idea. I did all the research. Jack didn’t even want to do the damn show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t Jack want to do a show about a haunted mansion in New York? That sounds like ratings gold.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Jack’s weird about New York. He was brought up here, but he’s got some strange aversion to coming back. He tried to torpedo the whole thing. Said he wouldn’t be caught dead in that house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you decided to prove him wrong.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jack Sinclair was killed in the McClaren house tonight.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Barry, why didn’t you give your keys back to the owner?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Uh – um – I was – I was upset. I forgot. Is – is he really dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were the one who set up the cameras, right?

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Yeah. So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you knew exactly where they were placed and how to avoid them when you snuck back into the house. You even knew how to program them to turn off at a certain point.

utterance.speaker: BARRY
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. I did not kill Jack. I wasn’t even there. I got stuck in the security line and missed my flight to LA, I went to the strip club right after that. You can check that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So TSA has Barry going through security at 9:15 at JFK. There’s no way that he was in the house at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Plus, tech checked out those cameras. They weren’t programmed to turn off. The only thing Barry is guilty of killing is time at a strip club.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So. If Barry’s not our guy, I think it’s time that we revisit the possibility that our killer is a –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you say ghost I’m sending you home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparition-American.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you figured out another way to explain the blood spatter?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No I haven’t, but I will. Apparently Jack Sinclair was very upset when he arrived in a taxicab tonight, so let’s find out where that cab picked him up and what he was doing there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ll see, Castle. This’ll turn out like every other murder investigation. Once we find out more about our victim’s life, the details surrounding his death, everything will be explained.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um… maybe not everything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I was reviewing the footage shot inside the house tonight looking for signs someone else was there, a shadow, a reflection, something. Instead, I found, uh … well, you better see for yourself.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I slowed down the video, but watch the tripod in the background.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There. You see it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well… um … I’m sure there’s a perfectly simple explanation for all of that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re he-ere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa. Did you get any sleep?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a wink, but it was worth it. After researching the history of the McClaren mansion, I think I know what happened to our victim ghost hunter Jack Sinclair. That coffee is for you, by the way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, the other one. That’s –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s – I’ll make you a – I’ll make you one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since the McClaren mansion was built in 1898, bodies have been piling up faster than a Tarantino movie, 8 killings in all, starting with the original owner, Robert Pettigrew, strangled, 1903, all the way to Melanie Benton, hacked to pieces, 1991. The current owner, Steve Fuller, tried to have the house torn down, but it was declared a landmark by the Society for Historical –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Castle. I appreciate your work, I do, but what does this have to do with our case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just getting to that. It seems that in almost all of these killings, the killer claimed that there was – ready for this – that a demon was responsible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A demon. Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not making this up! It’s in the books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. A demon killed Jack Sinclair. So what’s our next step? Are we going to stake out the house? Wait for the demon to show up? Zap him with our proton pack?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not a real thing, you know. That real ghost hunters use.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Real ghost hunters? Isn’t that a contradiction of terms, bro?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, does anyone have anything pertinent to our case?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I tracked down that cab that our vic took last night. The driver’s trip logs say that he picked up Jack on the corner of 38th and 9th.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have uniforms canvass the area with Jack’s photo. Let’s see what he was up to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, and phone records, too. Maybe that’ll shed some light on things.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I can shed some light on why Jack didn’t want to do the show here. Talked to an old high school pal that Jack had breakfast with a couple years ago. Turns out that our vic actually used to live right near the McClaren house. Said that he used to walk a couple blocks out of his way just to avoid walking past it. Said it gave him a creeped out feeling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You see … I’m telling you. There was something going on with this house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The last people … to …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The last people to live there moved out 4 years ago in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but I think it’s time we found out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knock yourself out, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not coming?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I’ve got a murder to solve.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. That’s a look.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I get these a lot. Just start walking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Faster.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just saw Ryan downstairs? I can’t believe you let him go chasing ghosts with Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe Shaggy’ll keep Scooby out of trouble. Besides, you never know. Maybe they’ll come up with something useful.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. You want useful? ‘Cause I just spoke to CSU. They found fingerprints at the scene. From a real live person. So …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His name is Ron Berger, lives in Queens. They’re picking him up now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does he have a record?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Chuckles did 8 years for armed robbery with a knife. He’s also dabbled in B and E, which makes breaking into a locked house no problem for this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did he get out of prison?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Five weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah… finally, a lead that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, it gets better. Ron has a history with our vic. Ghost Wranglers did a piece on Five Points Correctional and Ron was featured. Claims he was sharing a cell with a spirit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s prison overcrowding for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Apparently Casper was being a little too friendly. Touching Ron in all the wrong places.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Molested by a ghost? Wow, some people will do anything to get on TV.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, except it backfired on him. Ron became a laughing stock of the prison yard. He got all pissed off and he wrote the show a letter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “I’m going to make Jack Sinclair bleed for what he did to me.”

utterance.speaker: RON BERGER
utterance.content: I wrote that letter, yeah, but that’s as far as it went. I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night at 9PM?

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: I was at home. Watching cartoons.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: You can ask my mom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we have a problem, Ron. Because we found your fingerprints inside the McClaren house.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: I – I – I can explain that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m waiting.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: I can’t violate my parole. I can’t go back to Five Points. Not – not in that cell. Not with that … thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re worried about your ghost? Ron, you’re looking at murder. You’ve got a flimsy alibi, your fingerprints are all over the crime scene. You had means, motive, and opportunity.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: All right, all right. I was there. Just, not last night. About a month ago. I was there because of Jack. He – he called me after I got out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jack Sinclair called you after you threatened him?

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: To apologize for the prison show thing, and he – he had a request.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a request?

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Uh, it was a strange one. He wanted me to take pictures inside the McClaren house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why you?

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: It was locked up, so uh … I had to break in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he give you any reason for asking for those pictures?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’re going to need to see the photos.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So tech analyzed the SD card. Time and date stamp was not messed with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then Ron was telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, about the photos. I’m still not buying the whole ‘touched by a phantom’ routine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wonder what Jack wanted with all these photos. You know, all of the pictures are of just one room, the living room. That’s the same room as the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Jack hired Ron Berger to take pictures of the very room he was going to die in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s creepy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not creepy, Castle. I’m sure it can all be explained, and I’m sure that that living room has absolutely nothing to do with ghosts or demons.

utterance.speaker: MARGARET BOYER
utterance.content: It was the living room, definitely. That was the epicenter of the activity.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ms. Boyer, when you say activity …

utterance.speaker: MARGARET
utterance.content: We didn’t buy it, either. We had heard all about the McClaren house, its history. We laughed about it.

utterance.speaker: HARRY BOYER
utterance.content: At first, everything was fine.

utterance.speaker: MARGARET
utterance.content: Then it started. Lights going off, strange noises, doors slamming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did anything violent ever happen?

utterance.speaker: HARRY
utterance.content: One night we heard noises from the living room. We went downstairs, found the whole room trashed.

utterance.speaker: MARGARET
utterance.content: Tables flipped over, books ripped apart, pictures smashed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God, that’s terrible. Is that when you decided to move out?

utterance.speaker: HARRY
utterance.content: Not without a fight. We found this woman, this ghost hunter.

utterance.speaker: MARGARET
utterance.content: Said she was the best. Said all other ghost hunters came to her for help. But she took one look and told us to run like hell.

utterance.speaker: HARRY
utterance.content: Yeah… what was her name. Um… Mercy. That’s right. Mercy LaGrande.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Mercy, I can see it, Mercy’?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe Jack Sinclair wasn’t begging for mercy when he died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was saying her name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mercy LeGrande, real name Mercedes King, runs an unlicensed business doing paranormal consultations.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s a reason why she’s unlicensed. Check out this rap sheet. We’ve got ID theft, fraud, check fraud, and impersonating a religious official.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at where her business is located. 38th and 9th.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s on the same block our vic caught that cab.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Jack paid Mercy a visit, and then goes to the McClaren house upset.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hours later he says Mercy’s name right before he dies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the question is, how is she involved in all of this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, well …you know, Ryan and I will be happy to go check this out if you guys are too busy solving that murder.

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: I did what I could to help him, but I’d say it wasn’t enough.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did Jack Sinclair come to see you?

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: I’ve been in the McClaren house. He was going to face whatever’s in there and he wanted my advice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which you gave him. For a fee.

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: I’m not a charlatan, Detective. Someone with Jack Sinclair’s experience wouldn’t be seeking my counsel if I was. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he were that good, why would he seek your help?

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: This was not like any other house to him. When he took the assignment, the dreams started. Just glimpses, at first. Bits and pieces of a room, but then the dreams became nightmares. Figures. Bodies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whose bodies?

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: He didn’t know. But when we talked, more became clear to me. These weren’t dreams.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what were they?

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: Memories.

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: He witnessed great evil. Repressed it all these years, but the memories were too strong. They were coming back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was he remembering, exactly?

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: A woman. A lot of blood. A man, with a knife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was the man?

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: He said the face was blurred but getting clearer. I told him if he returned to the room where it happened, it might all come back to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Mercy, I can see it.’ That’s the murderer’s face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jack recovered the memory just before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The last murder in that house was twenty years ago. I read about the case. There were no witnesses.

utterance.speaker: MERCY
utterance.content: Oh, there was one. Jack Sinclair was there the night that woman died. He was there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The pictures aren’t pretty. Melanie Benton, sliced up the in the McClaren house on the night of April 20th, 1991. One guess where she was found.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The living room.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Give that man a prize.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, 1991. Jack Sinclair is what, 11? Still living in the neighborhood. I’m betting this is the murder he witnessed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but how did he witness a murder without the killer knowing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I did some digging. Jack had a paper route and the McClaren house was on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so … Jack shows up, maybe to collect money? Hears screams and he peers in through those windows. He started having dreams about what he’d seen all those years ago and he wanted to make sense of them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s why our vic hired Ron Berger to break in and take pictures of the living room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there ever an arrest made?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope. Which means the killer’s still out there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Jack Sinclair is just about to recover his memory and possibly ID our killer and he’s silenced.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was the investigating officer on the case?

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE ADDISON SMITH
utterance.content: I’ve been retired 10 years and I still think about this one. I was the first one on the scene and I gotta tell you, the pictures don’t even do it justice. What Matt Benton did to his poor wife…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Matt Benton? You think that Melanie was killed by her own husband?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Well, the neighbors complained about constant fighting, we put out an APB on Benton the night that Melanie was murdered, but he got away and he’s been on the lam ever since, so … it doesn’t take a genius to put it together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you hear anything about his whereabouts after he disappeared?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: We got one tip once about him being in Europe. But that’s – that’s got to be a good 15 years ago now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So somebody spotted him?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: No, he sent postcards to his brother. They were postmarked Vienna.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did they say? Do you remember?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: They all said the same thing. Benton claimed he wasn’t responsible for his wife’s death, something about a demon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really. He claimed there was a demon involved?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: I know, like anyone’s going to fall for that, right? I mean, what kind of jackass did he think he was dealing with?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you ever follow up on any of those postcards, Detective Smith?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: We got Interpol involved, but without any hard evidence against the guy – no murder weapon, no witness – you know, I don’t think they ever took it too seriously.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what if a witness came forward now? Would that change anything?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: That would change everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It sounds more and more like Matt Benton found out about Jack, decided to keep him quiet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But how did Matt find out Jack was recovering his memories?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I have an idea about that. I was rechecking our vic’s phone records. It turns out, a week before he died Jack Sinclair called the law firm of Lockhart, Wheelin, and Benton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Benton? As in –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pete Benton. Matt’s brother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the brother that Matt was sending those postcards to and –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He could have easily informed Matt that someone was asking questions. The wrong kind of questions.

utterance.speaker: PETE BENTON
utterance.content: My brother sent me those postcards over 15 years ago. I gave them to the cops. I haven’t heard from him since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And no contact since then, Mr. Benton?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not even after talking to Jack Sinclair?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Jack Sinclair?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The ghost hunter. He was killed in the McClaren house last night.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: I never spoke to Jack Sinclair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, his phone records show otherwise.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: I get calls every year from some TV producer looking to exploit my family’s tragedy and the legend of the McClaren mansion. Look, it’s a shame whatever happened to this guy, but if he called here, I did not talk to him. And I certainly haven’t spoken to my brother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if we check your phone records, we won’t find calls to Vienna?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: We’re an international law firm. We have clients all over Europe, including Vienna.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to need access to those phone logs.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Then you need a warrant. And you don’t have enough to get one.

utterance.speaker: SECRETARY
utterance.content: Mr. Benton, your car is downstairs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Law firm’s car service of choice is Execudrive. Here are Pete Benton’s billing slips, going back a month or so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there any unusual activity?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, the daily routine was the same, to and from work. Except for 4 days ago, when Pete authorized a pickup at JFK. International terminal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so maybe Pete did have his brother on speed dial. Where’d they go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fairwick Hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s take this down to the Fairwick and see if anyone recognizes Matt Benton.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, I had tech mock up an aged version of the photo. You know, Matt 20 years later.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Don’t you guys have dinner plans tonight?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah… we can move it to some night when Lanie’s not coming off a double shift.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, actually, Lanie’s really looking forward to it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? No worries. It’s on my way home.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That I don’t want to be the one to blame for ruining Lanie’s night out? Oh yeah. I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Honestly Richard, how do you plan to solve a one day old murder by reading a book about a hundred year old house?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sound just like Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There has to be a reason why all these things happened in the living room. All these murders … the tenants that had their furniture smashed. All in the same room.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Maybe that demon of yours did not like the furniture. You bring in a decorator, snazz up the place … all this nonsense might stop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Less like Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh… no need of snazzing up here. Look at you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow, you’re really taking these Skype dates with Ashley seriously.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m going to a party. Ash was supposed to call me hours ago, but I’m tired of waiting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, good for you, sweetheart. Have a good time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks, Dad. I’ll be back by midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Did you see that outfit? Should I be worried?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ashley’s the one that should be worried. Trust me, if he could see how she looked going out now he wouldn’t be so quick to leave her hanging.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, isn’t this funny? It’s Ashley. Decline. It’s almost as if he was listening in to our conversation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listening in. The architect for the McClaren house, he’s from Scotland.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is that important?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the key.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two words. Laird’s Lug.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Laird’s Lug?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Literally ‘Lord’s Ear’. It refers to a hidden alcove above a dining hall of many Scottish castles. The host could use it to eavesdrop on his guests.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I’ve either had too much wine or not enough.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seamus McClaren, builder of the McClaren house, grew up right next to Edinburgh Castle, notable for its Laird’s Lug. The concept so tickled him he put modern versions of it in several of his houses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying that the McClaren house has a hidden alcove.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It explains everything. How come the killings only happen place in that one room? How did the killers seemingly appear and disappear at will? Answers that have thus far remained elusive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of which, how did your canvassing go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Came up empty. There’s absolutely no evidence that Matt Benton was ever at the Fairwick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the evidence of his return will be in that alcove. It’s worth a shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll go first thing in the morning. See what we come up with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You wanna go now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, unless of course, you’re afraid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I get it. I mean, it is a haunted house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not scared, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah, nah. You’re right. You’re right. I mean, the demon has tasted fresh blood. Its thirst might not be slaked with just one victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, c’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, if you’re not scared, just say it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. You know you want to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t want to say it, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For me. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I ain’t afraid of no ghosts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. There have been a lot of murder investigations in here over the years, and I think they would have found a secret room if there actually was one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if it was hidden well enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, you’re going to regret it if we actually find this room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because then you’re going to have to admit that there is no demon behind all of this, that it’s nothing more than a boring old psycho killer hiding in a room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, unless it’s a psycho killer possessed by a demon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are you so determined to find the supernatural in all of this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why are you so determined not to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I am just following the evidence, wherever it may lead, and as a cop I’m going to consider every possible worldly explanation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. And what if there is none?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, I’m open to the alternatives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You? Skepticus maximus?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Just because I don’t talk about it nonstop doesn’t mean I don’t believe in another plane. I’ve actually had my own experiences.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get out. Like what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When I was a little girl, my parents rented a cabin by a lake. And one night I had to go to the bathroom… You know what? You’re just gonna think I’m crazy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. Go ahead, tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And on the way there I heard this voice whispering, “Kate. Kate.” It was coming from this room that the owners had locked up and told my parents to never go in it. Except that night there was this weird glow underneath the door and I heard the voice again, “Kate.” And so I walked up to the door, and this time it wasn’t locked. Then I turned the doorknob and I opened it up. Then I saw it…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was it? What did you see?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Heh ha. Very funny. Yes, you got me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long have you known me, Castle? Of course I don’t believe in ghosts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s odd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, that’s more than just odd. This is the same sequence of events that preceded Jack Sinclair’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except Jack just had an EMF meter. I’ve got a gun and a flashlight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With dead batteries.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I could swear I just put in new ones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know I saw some matches by these candles here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, Castle. Mature.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, here we go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was not me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so … maybe there’s a draft here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right … I think I can feel it. Right here. Give me a boost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is easy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle … c’mon. Just hold still. Geez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the noise on the tape, right before Jack Sinclair was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to go up. Ready? Grab my legs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I said legs! Okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, right. Legs. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not as sorry as I was. I’m around dead people all day. When I get home, I want a live one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was tired.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: I can’t believe we waited so long to do this, babe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah… yeah, it really did turn out to be a perfect night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I would like to propose a toast. I know that it’s kind of corny, but it’s me, so … there we go. Uh, to best friends. Now and forever.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And to the future newlyweds.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: Awww.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You are so thoughtful.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: You know, Kevin said you guys made a great couple, but I had no idea.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: So … when are you two getting married?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t this awkward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, secret passageways aren’t supposed to be the most convenient of places.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer could have hung upside down from this bar when he slit Jack Sinclair’s throat. That would provide you with your demon free explanation of the undisturbed blood spatter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well Castle, I appreciate the assist, but I could do without the massage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Aren’t you rubbing my neck?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Deep breaths, Castle. It’s just a rat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s something over there. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hidden passageways, secret rooms? I don’t know, Castle. The mystery of the McClaren mansion is looking less supernatural by the minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a magnetic field generator to knock out the video feed to the cameras. Someone planned very carefully how to kill Jack Sinclair the night he was filming here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Taxing the power supply. That could explain the lights flickering just before Jack’s death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the magnetic field could also explain the tripod moving that we saw in the video.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at these marks. There was a bed here. Matt Benton could have been here for days before Jack showed up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, this house has been largely unoccupied since the Melanie Benton killing. Maybe the reason they couldn’t find Matt Benton is because he never left. He could have been living here the whole time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And maybe he’s here now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Open the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God, my heart. I was so scared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am throwing away this coat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look. His cuffs are monogrammed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘MB’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like you were right, Castle. Matt Benton never did leave the McClaren mansion.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Dental records confirm it. That’s Matt Benton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tech really needs better software.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t know yet, but I’m guessing it wasn’t the world’s longest game of hide and seek.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long was he in there for?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Still waiting on the test results, but prelim reports on the tissue samples suggest he died about twenty years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so odds are he was killed at the same time his wife was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer hides Matt’s body, making it appear as though he fled, framing Matt for his wife’s murder, and throwing everyone off the trail of the real killer.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And it worked, too. For 20 years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, until Jack Sinclair showed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me know about the test results.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. How did that double date go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … I just …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys, one thing. If Matt was killed 20 years ago, then how’d he send those post cards to Pete 15 years ago?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think it’s time we took a harder look at Pete Benton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t ask about the date.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look, I said I’m sorry, okay? I didn’t mean to jinx the dinner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ‘It really is the perfect night.’

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny … got a little caught up in the moment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ‘When are you two getting married?’ That is a question you do not ask.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. It’s – it’s not entirely your guys’ fault.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You guys have a big fight after?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Big fight? No. Mega fight, yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The point is, we … um, we decided that we’re going to cool things off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What, do you mean split up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Just until we both figure out what we want.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anyway …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look brother, if you need me for anything you know I’m always here to …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, it may be nothing, but this light bulb? It’s brand new.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? Detective, this is bordering on harassment. I told you everything I know about my brother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not everything. You were engaged once, weren’t you Mr. Benton?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To a Melanie Wendell? Until Melanie broke it off and married your brother instead.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Things didn’t work out for us. I didn’t expect Melanie to stay single for forever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you never married. Because you never got over her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who really sent those postcards, Pete? Did you send them yourself?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about. My brother sent me those postcards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and I both know that’s not possible. Your brother has been dead for 20 years.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found his remains in the McClaren house. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: You think I killed my brother? You think I killed Melanie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you that night, Pete?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you exactly where I was. I went to dinner with my friend Marie. 7:30, Café Joie. We were out by 9, stopped at Dorian’s for a drink. I had a 7 and 7. Our server was Patrick.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: When something like that happens, it’s burned into your brain. Every detail of what happened the night you heard. I couldn’t forget it if I tried.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to have to verify your story, Pete.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: So, my – my brother didn’t kill Melanie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: I always assumed that he did. Matt had a terrible temper. He was convinced Melanie was cheating on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was she?

utterance.speaker: PETE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t surprise me if she was. Matt thought it was somebody at work.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It wasn’t someone Melanie worked with. I just tracked down George Banner, Melanie’s manager at Flywide Travel from 20 years ago. He said Melanie had two coworkers, both guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aha.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Married.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: To each other.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Flywide was in a high rise in Midtown, so maybe it was someone else in the building. Let’s get a list of all the tenants that were there when Melanie worked there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m not sure that’s necessary. Remember the light bulb I took from that secret room?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I traced the serial number. Belongs to a lot that was sold by the manufacturer directly to Fuller Estate Management.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As in, Steve Fuller?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Owner of the McClaren mansion.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That means that Fuller knew about that room and didn’t tell us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s only one reason why he wouldn’t tell us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because he’s the killer. Maybe Matt Benton was right about Melanie having an affair, only wrong about who she was having the affair with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only when things went bad, he killed her, killed Matt, and stashed his body in his own house where he knew no one would find it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And, he planned on destroying the evidence. He wanted to have the house torn down right after those murders but it was declared a landmark.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So he used that passageway to scare off tenants like the Boyers, growing the mansion’s legend so that no one would want to live there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when Jack Sinclair came sniffing around, he had to kill him, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great story. DA will never buy it. It’s all circumstantial.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s right. Anyone could have put that bulb in there. We have no proof.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we will. And I think I know just how to get Mr. Fuller to give up the ghost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Think he’ll show?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You told him about tomorrow, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, Castle. He thinks we’re going through that wall tomorrow morning. So if Fuller’s our guy, he should be coming for Matt Benton’s body tonight. If he’s our guy. I mean, he might not be our guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet … there he is. Of course, he might just be here to fix a busted toilet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You need a hand with that, Fuller?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Smith?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was … you … all this time? Why?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: You know, he was abusing her. Terrible things. I don’t think a month went by when we didn’t get called up to this house. And one day I stopped by just to check on her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were the affair.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: It wasn’t an affair. It was love.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did you kill her?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: I didn’t mean to. I just – she wanted to call it off with me and I couldn’t let that happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Matt Benton?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: The way he treated her, he deserved what he got.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And as the lead officer you knew you could steer the investigation off yourself and onto someone they’d never find.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then you sent those postcards. To keep your suspect alive.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: I let them think that he did it. It was his fault, anyway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Jack Sinclair? How did you find out about him?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: I promised Fuller that I would solve this case one day and I asked him to keep me informed of any developments.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that when Jack contacted Fuller about the crime scene, he called you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when we told Fuller we were going to check out that room tomorrow he called you then, too.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: You’re both very smart. But you’re forgetting one thing. This house is haunted.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Thanks for the gun, Detective. I really appreciate it. You know, I felt bad about Sinclair. I really did. But he knew too much about that night. Stuff that wasn’t in the papers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he had to go.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Get on your knees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Castle. He’s not going to shoot us. That won’t fit the legend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any more helpful hints you’d care to pass along to our killer?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: On your knees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think so, Addison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You see, the demon only really kills when no one is looking. And tonight, we have an audience.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They recorded your full confession.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: You have the right to remain silent …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So busted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ghost busted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks to Lulu.

utterance.speaker: LULU
utterance.content: It’s the least I could do for him, you know? For Jack.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Fuller had no idea about that room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, like we said before. Anyone could have grabbed the light bulb from another part of the house and placed it there. I guess Smith did it. He’s in with the DA right now writing his confession.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well, what I don’t get is if he was so in love with Melanie, why would he kill her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He said that a demon made him do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just laying the groundwork for his insanity plea, I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon Castle. Even you have to admit everything, every haunting, every death, everything even remotely connected to paranormal activity in the McClaren house can be explained by that passageway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. What about last night, when we were in the living room? How about the door? The light? The candle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Old wiring, drafty house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe it was something more. Think about it. If you hadn’t gone looking for the draft that blew out the candle you would have never found the passageway or Matt Benton’s body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Spell it out for those of us that are … paranormally impaired.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe someone wanted us to find that passageway. Maybe Jack Sinclair’s ghost was helping solve his own murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I will tell you what. I’ll admit to that possibility if you admit that there is no demon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did anyone … see …

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hi, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, you’re up late. Playing Skype tag with Ashley?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. We finally connected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… was it everything you hoped for in a peer-to-peer video conference and more?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Honestly, it was … blah. I mean, he was preoccupied and I was tired and … this whole time difference thing is a real drag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nobody said long distance was easy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, but is it supposed to be this hard?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I can tell you this. Any relationship that lasts longer than a breath mint is gonna have challenges. But if a relationship isn’t going to work out, it’s usually not because of the challenges. It’s usually because the relationship wasn’t strong enough to begin with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does this help?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But this always does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. I promise you this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If two people believe in something, really believe, anything, even the impossible, is possible.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Even flesh eating zombies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, especially flesh eating zombies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now where were we?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, right there.
